description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/orangutan
number of repeated trials until they succeed

level of planning required to succeed from 0 to 2 depending whether the participants had to consider the traps on the uppermost level only on the ahead or on second level or the third level underneath
number of levels that contain a trap (1-3)
trial order with the missing spots of those trials that were not included in the final dataset (1-24)
identification number of the trap configuration
whether the same maze configuration was presented for the first or second time (1-2)
whether the first decision in the first attempt was correct (0= incorrect/ 1= correct)
whether the first attempt to retrieve the food was successful (0= no/ 1= yes)
number of changes in direction necessary for the removal of the reward or not
sum of non-planning errors on the first level across all attempts within a trial (only LOP 0)
sum of planning errors across all attempts within a trial (only for LOP 1 and 2)
sum of non-planning errors across all attempts within a trial
